text: <@U0289USNA> <@U026PHQ3J> when creating posts you can set attachmentWidth and attachmentHeight to integers

“Well, the good news is I can reproduce what you are seeing.  The bad news is this seems to be a serious design flaw in our server that won't be fixed quickly.  It is actually the lack of any locking, table or otherwise, that allows requests to step on each other."
-HipChat Guy
oh great
I’m going to submit a formal request for a bulk member adding resource and ask him how long he predicts for either the resource or solving this bigger issue will take.
In the mean time I’ll try to run the requests as quickly as I can on our Jordan backend
The API version we’re using _is_ in beta :neutral_face:
HipChat guy responded already
"As for length, honestly, probably months as the integration team is slammed trying to do some basic stuff for our upcoming Atlassian Summit conference.  What are you building?"
:disappointed:
We need to get Jordan to throw their promised weight around on this

Bummer! Thanks for investigating, Jenny. I think it's reasonable to limit the amount of users in a single, particularly for launch. We can let them know that it might be able to be unlimited in the future, but I don't think it's a big usability issue.
10 people? 20? Each takes x seconds to load, right?
yeah. i’ll do some more detailed investigating today and see how much of a delay we’re looking at for each user
then we can decide on what the limit is?
sounds good to me.
